sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to Good Morning Europe. It's Monday the 6th of June. I'm Andrea Balaizo and these are your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Britain says it will send long-range missiles to Ukraine, despite warnings from Russia that it will extend its targets if such weapons are delivered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Veterans get ready to mark the 78th anniversary of D-Day and to pay their respects to fallen soldiers as another war rages in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Queen Elizabeth expresses her gratitude for festivities marking her 70-year reign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Despite not attending every event, she says she is still committed to serve as monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: to serve as monarch. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy travelled to the Zaporizhia region in Ukraine's south-east on Sunday, making only his second public visit outside the Kyiv area since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He met with internally displaced Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Zaporizhia is now partly under Russian control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Back in the capital, the railway infrastructure appears to have borne the brunt of Russian missile strikes in the early hours of Sunday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: However, the Kremlin claims to have targeted a site storing tanks supplied by Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Kyiv was hit for the first time in months, having largely been spared recently as Russian forces concentrate attacks on Donbass and eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But Russian President Vladimir Putin has vowed to extend his targets if the West carries through with its promises of sending longer-range weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Despite the warning, Britain says it's going ahead with sending Ukraine such a shipment of rocket artillery, which are more modern than those currently being operated by its troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the meantime, as Moscow continues to throw all its power into capturing the Donbass, one of its airstrikes struck in the eastern city of Druzhkivka, destroying buildings and leaving at least one person dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Britain's Queen Elizabeth has written a thank you letter following a weekend of festivities marking her 70 year reign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: While acknowledging she had been unable to attend all the events, she remained committed to serving as a monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In a spirit of gratitude, the Queen said, I have been humbled and deeply touched that so many people have taken to the streets to celebrate my Platinum Jubilee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Four days of celebrations ended on Sunday with a pageant along the same route as the Queen had taken on the day of her coronation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: More than 6,000 people took part, including celebrities and cotton performers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It was a spectacle, just like Saturday night's concert in the palace and the Thanksgiving service in St. Paul's Cathedral, both attracting thousands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Very exhilarating, a once-in-a-lifetime experience, especially when we actually got to see the Queen come out on the balcony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That was just, everyone around me was crying, especially singing the anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I didn't expect to see her today because she was not very well, I suppose, but yes, absolutely great to see her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Not very well, I suppose, but yes, absolutely great to see her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Queen's last-minute appearance on the balcony of Buckingham Palace brought to an end the special extended weekend of celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Well, I'm here at one of thousands of street parties taking place across the UK, despite the chilly weather, people gathering to celebrate Her Majesty's 70 years on the throne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And it's been an incredible four days of celebration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We saw the Queen herself appear on the balcony at Buckingham Palace to watch that RAF fly past overhead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: fly past overhead. She led the lighting of the beacons, beacons lit all across the country and across the Commonwealth too to honor that 70 years on the throne. We had the platinum party at the palace, an absolute musical spectacular featuring the likes of Duran Duran, Andrea Bocelli and the rock band Queen, all led by Prince Charles, who paid a touching tribute to his mother, to the Queen, he calls her Mummy, and of course all rounded off with a huge platinum procession through central London, at a cost, I have to say, of some Â£15 million to the taxpayer, featuring 10,000 people, and all rounded off with a rendition of the national anthem sung to the Queen, led by Ed Sheeran, rounding off an incredible four-day event the likes of which we've never seen before and we're unlikely to ever see again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Victoria Smith for Euronews in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Crowds gather at the viewpoint of Omaha Beach in France. The vast stretches of wet sand extending toward

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: distant cliffs show the immensity of the task faced by Allied soldiers on June 6, 1944.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 150,000 troops landed on then-Nazi-occupied Normandy shore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We can't forget. We can't forget what happened 78 years ago. And, you know, we're seeing it happen in some ways again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so people need to open their eyes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And I don't think what's happening in Ukraine is I don't think people are confused by what's really happening there, especially when certain terms are being used that, you know, brings up and evokes the past in ways that are not appropriate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: War II was like, the sort of scenery where they landed on the beaches and the amount of people that have given their lives to sacrifice for the freedom of everyone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Monday marks 78 years since the largest seaborne invasion in history. Each year, ceremonies are held across Normandy to pay tribute to the achievements and sacrifices of those who fought there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Five European Union nations who fear waves of refugees from impoverished African countries

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: are calling for an end to the EU's voluntary solidarity on migrants. Interior ministers from the Mediterranean nations of Italy, Cyprus, Greece, Malta and Spain wrapped up two days of talks in Venice on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While fighting illegal migration and smuggling, we're fully in favor of more legal pathways for migration to Europe. We cannot let the smugglers decide who comes and lives in Europe. This is why my country is investing in bilateral cooperation schemes with origin countries, offering more opportunities for work permits in exchange for better cooperation in return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The summit focused only on controlling potential refugees from Africa coming into southern Europe amid concerns of hardship following the blockade of Ukraine's grain exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It did not address the millions of Ukrainian refugees arriving in northern EU nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This is the moment Iranian Revolutionary Guards seized two Greek oil tankers in the Persian Gulf last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in the Persian Gulf last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The country's supreme leader says it's in retaliation for the role Athens played in the U.S. seizure of crude oil from Iranian-flagged tankers that same week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This because of a violation of sanctions imposed by Washington in Tehran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Iranian oil was stolen off the coast of Greece and then the brave soldiers of the Islamic Republic made up for it by seizing the enemy oil ship. The enemy accuses Iran of theft through widespread propaganda in its media empire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But it was they who stole our oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The seizures have escalated tensions between Iran and the West after talks in Vienna on the nuclear deal have been stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Since the deal's collapse, Iran has a rapidly growing stockpile of enriched uranium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It insists its current nuclear program is for peaceful purposes. But United Nations experts and Western intelligence agencies say they're mindful Iran had an organized military nuclear program through 2003. Thank you.
